entry.title: Roseburg mom pulls kids from Fremont Middle School after son suffers broken arm in class
entry.summary: A Douglas County grand jury issued a "no true bill" for instructors Brian Marsters and Erich Hoque, finding insufficient evidence to pursue criminal charges related to injuries sustained by students at Fremont Middle School, including a 13-year-old nonverbal autistic boy;…

entry.title: PacifiCorp Agrees to $575 Million Settlement With U.S. Over Six Western Wildfires Including Archie Creek
entry.summary: PacifiCorp agreed to pay $575 million to settle federal claims tied to six wildfires in Oregon and California. The funds will reimburse suppression costs and support land restoration. The settlement resolves allegations only, and the company continues to deny liability.

entry.title: Grand Jury Declines Charges Against Two Fremont Middle School Instructional Aides
entry.summary: A Douglas County grand jury returned a no true bill for two Fremont Middle School instructional aides, finding insufficient evidence to pursue criminal charges in a case involving injuries to two students. An investigation into a separate teacher at the school remains ongoing.

entry.title: Roseburg Begins Downtown Parking Meter Removal, New Time-Limit Signs Going Up
entry.summary: Roseburg crews are removing downtown parking meters and installing new signs for free, time-limited parking. The changes expand one-, two-, and three-hour zones and include updated permit fees for city lots and the parking garage. On-street permits will be available once signs are in place.

entry.title: Ask A Master Gardener: Supporting bees when nothing blooms
entry.summary: Question: A couple weeks ago I saw a bumblebee out and about. Don’t they usually hibernate? Are there things I can plant in my yard to support them when nothing much is blooming?

entry.title: Thrilling reads for exciting times
entry.summary: Between watching the Winter Olympics and the medical drama “The Pitt,” my adrenaline has been pumping this month. For readers seeking a thrill, I recommend these recently published books.

entry.title: Cow Creek Umpqua, Forest Service sign new stewardship agreement
entry.summary: Cow Creek Band of Umpqua Tribe of Indians and U.S. Department of Agriculture Forest Service signed a new shared stewardship agreement, designed to expand collaborative forest and rangeland restoration in the Umpqua and Rogue River-Siskiyou national forests.

entry.title: Notice of intent issued for revisions to BLM's O&C Resource Management Plan
entry.summary: Since 1937, over 2 million acres of Oregon's timberland has remained under the jurisdiction of the U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI) as O&C timberlands. Now, plans dictating how those lands are managed may be going through major changes.

entry.title: Roseburg Schools To Host Final Early Literacy Night For Young Families March 9
entry.summary: Roseburg Schools will host its final early literacy night March 9 at Rose Elementary for families with children ages 2–4. The free event includes storytelling, hands-on activities and take-home materials for early readers. Registration is required and space is limited.

entry.title: Respected and beloved: the life of Terry Lea Deane
entry.summary: Terry Lea Deane, or “Grandma Terry” to her family, doted on her great-grandkids, was a jokester with a contagious laugh, and didn’t go anywhere without her lapdog Sadie.

entry.title: Police Log: February 13 - February 17, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests and citations Feb. 12–13, including DUII arrests, several warrant arrests, a harassment arrest after an alleged spitting incident, a driving-while-suspended citation, and a drinking-in-public citation, according to police logs.

entry.title: SUTHERLIN POLICE CHARGE MAN WITH STRANGULATION
entry.summary: February 17, 2026 Sutherlin Police charged a man with strangulation on Monday afternoon. An SPD report said at 2:00 p.m. officers responded to a disturbance in the 100 block of Myrtle Street. The investigation revealed that a 43-year-old had allegedly grabbed a victim by the throat, leaving marks on her neck. The victim’s service dog...
